content.description: Stand start with right hand on a small crimp and left hand gaston on a right angling edge, pull the right foot on a bad foot at the base of the 'floating' boulder (establishing is the crux) and then punch up, and a little left, to a good jug at the lip of the boulder. Match it up, adjust feet, and then pull an easy topout.
content.protection: Couple of pads, there is a rock slab behind this climb making the landing uneven.
content.location: On the right side of Boulder 1, if facing this climb you back would be to the Coffee Milk and Frisbee boulders. This climb sits on the 'floating' boulder to the right of Pick your Poison and The Skipper.

content.description: Start underneath the roof on good holds in the crack. Move up to the sloping lip of the boulder and trend right for several moves until you come to a small crimp a little further back from the lip of the boulder. Match the crimp and then reach even further back to a gaston with the right hand. Reel in the gaston and you can then easily press up over the lip.
content.protection: Pad or two, the climb is low to the ground and the landing is flat.
content.location: On the backside of Boulder 1 if approaching from the parking lot > train tracks. This climb is further down the boulder from Pick 6/Pick your Motion. From this problem, you can see the Overhangs/Buttcrack area.

content.description: Start right of Pick your Poison on low crimp. Use barely there feet to establish on lip out left and topout where Pick your Poison tops out

Start with both hands matched on a good edge about halfway up the middle of the prow, feet down low at the base of the prow. Pull on to the boulder and throw the left foot up to the jug rail and use it to pull your left hand up to that rail too. Heel the right side of the prow and use that to bring the right hand up the right arete to the top of the boulder. Adust feet and match the left hand on the top of the boulder. Top out up and left of the prow, rolling up on to the ledge and over the prow. Easier top out if you go around the corner and top-out as for Pick your Poison.
content.location: The front face of Boulder 1 with your back to the train tracks. In between Bougie time and Pick your Poison.

content.description: Start as for Bougie Time but traverse left through sloping lip until you reach 2 small crimps to use for toping out.
Start around right of Bougie Time on low crimps. Finish straight up on your choice of small crimps and big move to lip, top out on jug

Start matched on a shelf down and ~5' left of the top out of Pick your Potion. Work right along the shelf for a few moves using big feet out left. Switch feet around and throw the right foot in a huge crack in the rock and from there bump right hand up to the lip. There is an okay sloper at the lip or you can bump to one of the crimps used during the finish of Pick your Poison. Match up on the lip, link into Pick your Poison, and finish the top out of that climb.
content.location: On the left side of Boulder 1, if looking at the boulder the train tracks would be off tho the right. the main face with Bougie time and Keelhauling would be down the little hill and around the corner to the left. Starts ~5' left of the top out of Pick your Potion and uses the same top out.

content.description: start as for Pick your Poison but traverse left and finish Pick your Potion. Pumpy
Start Bougie Time but traverse right low on arete (crimp only)  and into Pick your Poison. Finish Pick your Poison

This is Rocky Point's version of Take a Seat (a V8 at Lincoln Woods), though much easier. Start sitting in the alcove with a decent right hand and a small left crimp. Make a dyno to a jug and climb jugs to the top. Someone must have done this previously, but it is a worthwhile little one mover.
content.location: In an alcove, just right of the start of Don't Tell Clare and left of a tree that has grown over the rock.

content.description:
Start completely underneath the rock with both hands matched on a small horn the boulder is matched on, left heel further down the horn and right foot high up on the right face of the boulder where you make the first right hand move to. 

 Pull off the ground and match your right hand to where the foot is, above you off to the right on a small crimp, and flag the right foot off to the left. Bump the left hand out to the left arete of the boulder. From here, either bump again to the start of Don't Tell Clare OR use some funky hand-foot beta to gain a match on the left side of the boulder. 

 Either way, make your way from the horn under the boulder to the start of Don't Tell Clare and then finish that problem.
content.location: On the backside of Boulder 1 on the thin boulder jutting out. The finish of the climb has the larger boulder directly behind you. This problem starts on the big horn underneath the boulder jutting out to the path, above the small rock coming up out of the ground that the problem is perched on.

content.description: start on opposite end of boulder on left side of thin boulder. Work your way right around arete to top out on jugs. Low ball but fun
Start sitting on low left jugs with back to road and finish straight up and right on cool jugs and stacked lips

This route is on the small slab boulder to the left of boulder 1.   Start on holds to the right of the crack, use the crack and face holds to the top.   I pulled a lot of poison ivy off and scrubbed lichens and discovered this rare Rocky Point slab problem.
content.location: On a slabby boulder to the left of Boulder 1. Start with left hand on the crack and right on a small ridge.

content.description: First boulder you come to with fallen tree on it
